qas.question: Who did Switzerland finally grant the right to vote to following the rest of the Western republic?
When were Switzerland women granted the right to vote on a federal level?
Who was the first woman to serve on the Federal Council?
Who was Switzerland's first female president?
In what year did Ruth Dreifuss become president?

context: Switzerland was the last Western republic to grant <a0_0>women<a0_0/> the right to vote. Some Swiss cantons approved this in 1959, while at the federal level it was achieved in <a1_0>1971<a1_0/> and, after resistance, in the last canton Appenzell Innerrhoden (one of only two remaining Landsgemeinde) in 1990. After obtaining suffrage at the federal level, women quickly rose in political significance, with the first woman on the seven member Federal Council executive being <a2_0>Elisabeth Kopp<a2_0/>, who served from 1984–1989, and the first female president being <a3_0>Ruth Dreifuss<a3_0/> in <a4_0>1999<a4_0/>.
